prompt: Line graph showing fructan levels throughout the day. X-axis: time of day. Y-axis: fructan level. Curve starts LOW in morning, rises to first peak at midday, dips slightly, then rises to HIGHEST peak in evening.

Graph showing relationship between temperature and fructan. X-axis: Temperature (Temperatur). Y-axis: Fructan level. Show that fructan is HIGH when temperature is LOW (below 5°C) and LOW when temperature is HIGH.
Simple diagram showing: Sun → Photosynthesis → Fructan production. Arrow from sun to grass to fructan molecule symbol.
Timeline/calendar showing gradual increase of grazing time. Day 1: 10 min, Day 3: 20 min, Day 7: 30 min, Day 14: 1 hour, Day 21: 2 hours.
Clock diagram showing best grazing times. Morning (6-10 Uhr): GREEN/SAFE. Midday-Evening (12-18 Uhr): RED/CAUTION.
Simple grass illustration showing optimal height. Too short (<5cm): danger icon. Optimal (10-15cm): checkmark. Too tall (>20cm): warning.
Simple horse silhouette with risk factors labeled: Übergewicht (belly area), Hufrehe-Vorgeschichte (hooves), EMS/Cushing (general).
Weather icons with fructan risk levels: Sunny+Cold = HIGH RISK (red). Cloudy+Warm = LOW RISK (green). Frost = VERY HIGH RISK (red).
Checklist format with checkboxes: Wetter geprüft, Grashöhe gecheckt, Weidezeit begrenzt, Pferd beobachtet.
Horse hoof diagram with early warning signs: Wärme (heat), Pulsation, Wendigkeit (reluctance to turn), Trachtenfußung.
